title: Looking for a geometric sans
content:
Hi all,

I'm looking for a geometricish sans that has display qualities similar to Futura, but has text qualities like Frutiger. Preferably available in a family with a range of weights from Light to Black, and presence of hanging figures.

Any suggestions? :)

Best,  
Artur
author: Artur Schmal

comments.content:
I like Locator a lot (@Process Type) and used it in my own ID. No hanging figs, tho…

. . .  
Bert Vanderveen BNO

[Avenir](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106223646/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Avenir) – [Frutiger](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106223646/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Adrian%20Frutiger)’s [Futura](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106223646/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Futura) – would be an obvious answer, no?  
 [Avenir Next](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106223646/http:/typophile.com/node/27007) comes with old-style figures.

Have a look at [Thomas Phinney](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106223646/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Thomas%20Phinney)’s [Hypatia Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106223646/http:/www.adobe.com/type/browser/landing/hypatia/hypatia.html): 6 weights from Extralight to Black (though no Italics [yet](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106223646/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41338)), and all kind of figures you can imagine. Once you found your way throught the various OpenType Stylistic Subsets, Hypatia Sans will turn out to be a very [versatile system](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106223646/http:/typophile.com/node/33619).

F
Was about to suggest Museo Sans, too. XD

Thanks for the suggestions so far guys!

Best,  
Artur
